overview_of_class: This course will explore the music of Claude Debussy (1862-1918) in the contexts of turn-of-the-century French culture and musical modernism. We will engage in both musical analysis and cultural interpretation of his compositions for orchestra (Prelude to the Afternoon of a Faun; La mer) and piano (the Préludes and Images); his songs (Fêtes galantes; Chansons de Bilitis); the opera Pelléas et Mélisande, and the ballet Jeux, among many other works, and we will also listen to music by Debussy's most significant French contemporaries (Fauré, Satie, Ravel). Ultimately, our goal is to place Debussy's innovations in timbre, harmony, and expression - and his aesthetics more broadly -amidst the artistic, poetic, intellectual, and political currents of his time, including the impressionist and symbolist movements, exoticism, nationalism, and Wagnerism.
